content:
• Wednesday, October 19, 2011
  • NAVB

    Shares of NeoProbe (NEOP) jump in post-trading after the FDA agrees to review its new-drug...

    Shares of NeoProbe (NEOP) jump in post-trading after the FDA agrees to review its new-drug application for its cancer-detection agent Lymphoseek. Shares +16% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:01 PM
  • PLCM

    Shares of Polycom (NASDAQ:PLCM) get hit in the post-session after its Q3 misses on all counts....

    Shares of Polycom (NASDAQ:PLCM) get hit in the post-session after its Q3 misses on all counts. Despite a 37% Y/Y rise in revenue, sequential growth in the top line was weaker than the company had predicted due to a slowdown in emerging market sales. Shares -16.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • RVBD

    Riverbed (NASDAQ:RVBD) is now up 12.3% AH, after the networking gear vendor rebounds from a weak...

    Riverbed (NASDAQ:RVBD) is now up 12.3% AH, after the networking gear vendor rebounds from a weak Q2 with a healthy Q3 that included 24% Q/Q growth in EMEA sales - a source of weakness in Q2. Riverbed is guiding for Q4 revenue of $198M-$202M and EPS of $0.24-$0.25, compared with a consensus of $199.5M and $0.23. FFIV is up 1.8% in sympathy. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM
  • WDC

    As expected, Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) guides its FQ2 EPS lower on reduced hard drive shipments...

    As expected, Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) guides its FQ2 EPS lower on reduced hard drive shipments due supply constraints from the Thailand flooding. The company says its recovery will take several quarters. Comments from management in its conference call: "Since we have greater direct manufacturing exposure to the flooded areas, we believe the impact on our business in the short term will be greater than to other hard drive disk manufacturers." Shares -5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM
  • DTLK

    Datalink (NASDAQ:DTLK) Q3 easily beats estimates, with record earnings on the back of strong...

    Datalink (NASDAQ:DTLK) Q3 easily beats estimates, with record earnings on the back of strong new-customer growth. In addition, the company says its pipeline and order flow over the first few weeks of the current quarter indicate that this momentum should continue through Q4 as well. It raises its Q4 EPS forecast to around $0.21-$0.27, above Street EPS expectations for $0.20. Shares +4.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM
  • CMC

    Shares of Commercial Metals (NYSE:CMC) +5.9% AH as Carl Icahn discloses plans to push out some...

    Shares of Commercial Metals (NYSE:CMC) +5.9% AH as Carl Icahn discloses plans to push out some of the metal recycling company’s directors. Icahn is CMC’s biggest shareholder with nearly 10% of its outstanding stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • WYNN

    More on Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN): Q3 earnings miss the mark, despite a continued surge in...

    More on Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN): Q3 earnings miss the mark, despite a continued surge in profit from its Chinese resort in Macau. Revenues in the Asian gambling hotbed leapt 41% Y/Y, but were offset by sagging profits from its Las Vegas operations, where net casino revenues were just $126.9M for the quarter, down 8.3% Y/Y. Shares -4.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • CRUS

    More on Cirrus Logic's (NASDAQ:CRUS) FQ2 report: The company is guiding for FQ3 revenue of...

    More on Cirrus Logic's (NASDAQ:CRUS) FQ2 report: The company is guiding for FQ3 revenue of $102M-$108M, a range that's effectively below a $108M consensus. Cirrus, which supplies audio processing chips for the iPhone (NASDAQ:AAPL), says it's "seeing softness" in some parts of its business due to macro issues. CRUS -13% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • BWLD

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD): Q3 EPS of $0.61 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $197.8M (+31% Y/Y) beats...

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD): Q3 EPS of $0.61 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $197.8M (+31% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Shares +5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • LRCX

    Lam Research (NASDAQ:LRCX): Q3 EPS of $0.58 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $680M (+15% Y/Y) beats...

    Lam Research (NASDAQ:LRCX): Q3 EPS of $0.58 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $680M (+15% Y/Y) beats by $9M. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • EBAY

    More on eBay's (NASDAQ:EBAY) Q3 results:  $526M in free cash flow, below net income of...

    More on eBay's (NASDAQ:EBAY) Q3 results:  $526M in free cash flow, below net income of $628.2M. Marketplaces revenue +14% Y/Y to $1.35B, Payments revenue +29% to $1.03B. PayPal accounts +14% Y/Y to 103M. Company expects Q4 revenue of $3.2B-$3.35B and EPS of $0.55-$0.58, compared with consensus of $3.3B and $0.58.  EBAY -4.9% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • EBAY

    eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY): Q3 EPS of $0.48 inline. Revenue of $2.97B (+32% Y/Y) beats by $60M. EBAY...

    eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY): Q3 EPS of $0.48 inline. Revenue of $2.97B (+32% Y/Y) beats by $60M. EBAY -4.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • MTB

    M&T Bank (MTB -5.7%) takes a hit after its Q3 earnings fell 4.6% Y/Y due to fewer new loans...

    M&T Bank (MTB -5.7%) takes a hit after its Q3 earnings fell 4.6% Y/Y due to fewer new loans and larger than expected merger-related charges. The lower profits hit margins hard as the regional bank continues in its struggle to reduce its loan write-offs.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • AABA

    The WSJ says multiple buyout firms are looking at a deal for Yahoo (YHOO +2.8% to $15.90) in the...

    The WSJ says multiple buyout firms are looking at a deal for Yahoo (YHOO +2.8% to $15.90) in the $16-$18/share range.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • VRA

    Vera Bradley (VRA +2%), Steven Madden (SHOO +0.1%) and Fossil (FOSL -1%) stand out among...

    Vera Bradley (VRA +2%), Steven Madden (SHOO +0.1%) and Fossil (FOSL -1%) stand out among accessory and footwear makers due to their supply-chain capabilities and growth opportunities, Citi says as it initiates the trio with Buy ratings. The firm cites business models that quickly read selling trends and react by executing on new product ideas and/or changing inventory plans.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • PJC

    Piper Jaffray (PJC -8.5%) plunges after reporting Q3 revenue of $98.5M (-15% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    Piper Jaffray (PJC -8.5%) plunges after reporting Q3 revenue of $98.5M (-15% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.23, missing Street forecasts by $10M and $0.43. Weakness in the company's capital raising, fixed-income brokerage, and asset management businesses more than offset strength in Piper's advisory business.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • TRV

    Investors prefer to focus on Travelers' (TRV +5.9%) plan to pursue targeted pricing and changes...

    Investors prefer to focus on Travelers' (TRV +5.9%) plan to pursue targeted pricing and changes in terms and conditions rather than its 67% Y/Y profit drop, boosting shares. A multiyear streak of outsized losses from severe weather is the top factor in providing an impetus to raise rates across all its operating segments. Insurance peers: CB +2.1%, ACE +3.4%, WRB +2.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • PTP

    Reinsurance firm Platinum Underwriters (PTP +7.6%) surges after reporting Q3 revenue of $199.4M...

    Reinsurance firm Platinum Underwriters (PTP +7.6%) surges after reporting Q3 revenue of $199.4M (-22% Y/Y) and EPS of -$1.43, beating consensus by $14.6M and $0.23. The company's results were hit by claims related to Japan and New Zealand's earthquakes.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • ZLC

    Zale (ZLC +12.7%) bucks the selloff in the markets today after BofA Merrill Lynch ups the shares...

    Zale (ZLC +12.7%) bucks the selloff in the markets today after BofA Merrill Lynch ups the shares to Buy from Neutral on valuation, citing higher comps. Shares of the company are up 14.01% to $3.58.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -11.8%) dives yet again, after David Einhorn publishes the slides...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -11.8%) dives yet again, after David Einhorn publishes the slides from his bearish presentation. The SEC's rule 201 has gone into effect, as bulls seeing a hit product and sky-high growth continue arguing with bears seeing a steep valuation and potential accounting issues.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -11.5%) are off more than 20% since David Einhorn...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -11.5%) are off more than 20% since David Einhorn lasered in on the company's shortcomings, but catch a small lifeline when KeyBanc's Akshay Jagdale comments on his own Buy rating and $120 price target. He says issues raised in Einhorn's bearish case (.pdf) aren't new, and maintains the company is well-positioned to take advantage of licensing deals with SBUX and DNKN.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • JAGGF

    Jaguar Mining (JAG -18%) gets hit today after lowering its FY11 gold production outlook to...

    Jaguar Mining (JAG -18%) gets hit today after lowering its FY11 gold production outlook to 155,000-163,000 ounces at an average cash cost ranging from $835-$845 an ounce. The company attributes the reduction to continuing mill issues at its Paciência mine.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 3 Comments
  • USO

    No market for old men. Cruising along at a one month high, oil is knocked lower by $2 in a...

    No market for old men. Cruising along at a one month high, oil is knocked lower by $2 in a matter of minutes by just a slight breath of "risk off." WTI is now at $86.25/barrel after threatening $90 earlier this morning. USO -2.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM -4.2%) reportedly cancels a meeting between activist investor Jaguar...

    Research In Motion (RIMM -4.2%) reportedly cancels a meeting between activist investor Jaguar Financial and two board members to discuss corporate governance. RIM's new BBX mobile operating system has received a lackluster response so far; combined with "stunning" moves such as the nixed meeting, Jonathan Chen sees "a company that appears dead without knowing it."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • AABA

    In spite of having risen the last 6 weeks on buyout speculation, Yahoo (YHOO +3.6%) is up again...

    In spite of having risen the last 6 weeks on buyout speculation, Yahoo (YHOO +3.6%) is up again today following a Q3 EPS beat, and inline Q4 guidance that soothed investors fearing the worst. The company's statement about extending its search deal with Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) through March 2013 is also going over well. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • AAPL

    Not all the pros who follow Apple (AAPL -5%) are so sanguine about its earnings miss. Doug Kass,...

    Not all the pros who follow Apple (AAPL -5%) are so sanguine about its earnings miss. Doug Kass, for one, wonders why analysts failed to properly gauge the big impact the iPhone 4S would have on last quarter's sales. Blaming results on “product transitions” often means growth is maturing, so has it peaked at Apple? Plus, Kass thinks too many people are long Apple for the shares to work.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 15 Comments
  • NEU

    NewMarket (NEU +2.8%) gains on an upgrade to buy from Longbow, citing the positive impact on its...

    NewMarket (NEU +2.8%) gains on an upgrade to buy from Longbow, citing the positive impact on its margins from recent base oil price decreases.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • KNL

    Shares of Knoll (KNL -11.4%) retreat sharply after the firm records a $0.07 EPS beat on revenue...

    Shares of Knoll (KNL -11.4%) retreat sharply after the firm records a $0.07 EPS beat on revenue 18% higher Y/Y off of a soft comparable. Investors seem to be honing in on the narrowing margins the furniture maker cites as its restructuring costs increase.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • AAWW

    Atlas Air Worldwide (AAWW -3.8%) dips after finalizing a new, five-year collective bargaining...

    Atlas Air Worldwide (AAWW -3.8%) dips after finalizing a new, five-year collective bargaining agreement with the pilots and flight engineers of Atlas Air and Polar Air Cargo Worldwide. Under the new agreement, both pilot groups will work from a single contract.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM
  • LEAF

    Demand Media (DMD -13.4%) is diving on high volume, making a new 52-week low along the way. The...

    Demand Media (DMD -13.4%) is diving on high volume, making a new 52-week low along the way. The company has been seeing a growing backlash among freelance contributors to its efforts to improve the quality of its content. A recent move to allow certain writers to claim article assignments ahead of others is adding to the angst.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • ABT

    Abbott Labs' (ABT +2%) Q3 report reveals it recorded a $1.5B charge to cover a potential...

    Abbott Labs' (ABT +2%) Q3 report reveals it recorded a $1.5B charge to cover a potential settlement stemming from a Justice Department investigation of allegations it promoted its Depakote anti-seizure drug for unauthorized uses. Such a settlement would be one of the largest such resolutions ever in the drug industry. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • CWTR

    Women's retailer Coldwater Creek (CWTR -19%) announces the details of its offering, saying it...

    Women's retailer Coldwater Creek (CWTR -19%) announces the details of its offering, saying it will sell 26.5M shares priced at a 23% discount from Tuesday's close.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • GSK

    Shares of Human Genome Sciences (HGSI) soar 15% higher after chatter picks up speculating it...

    Shares of Human Genome Sciences (HGSI) soar 15% higher after chatter picks up speculating it hired Goldman Sachs to explore alternatives for the firm, including selling itself. Yesterday's rumor du jour focused on GlaxoSmithKline making a play for the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU -9.2%) and Ericsson (ERIC -5.3%) are off sharply following supplier...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU -9.2%) and Ericsson (ERIC -5.3%) are off sharply following supplier Powerwave's (PWAV -42.5%) huge warning. The former is also being hit by a downgrade from Jefferies - the firm is worried about declining EV-DO equipment sales now that S and VZ are embracing LTE, and thinks 2H North American telecom capex could be weak. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • SVU

    Despite an early morning pop on an earnings beat, Supervalu (SVU -4%) has quickly lost steam and...

    Despite an early morning pop on an earnings beat, Supervalu (SVU -4%) has quickly lost steam and now hovers solidly in negative territory. The company cut the high-end of its FY12 earnings guidance due to expectations of weaker sales and fewer store openings.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • RNOW

    RightNow Technologies (RNOW -5.6%) takes a hit after Stifel Nicolaus cut the shares to hold on...

    RightNow Technologies (RNOW -5.6%) takes a hit after Stifel Nicolaus cut the shares to hold on valuation. The firm says the stock is currently fairly valued, despite its strong near-term fundamentals.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • DWDP

    DuPont (DD -1.3%) files a patent-infringement suit against Monsanto (MON -2.4%), alleging it...

    DuPont (DD -1.3%) files a patent-infringement suit against Monsanto (MON -2.4%), alleging it violated a patent for its seed production technique that increases seed corn vigor to improve germination under stress. Monsanto disputes the claim, saying it pertains to defoliating corn plants with Paraquat or Roundup, an approach that isn't used in any of its production fields.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • HA

    Shares of Hawaiian Airlines (NASDAQ:HA), up 9.5%, hold on to their AH gains logged after the...

    Shares of Hawaiian Airlines (NASDAQ:HA), up 9.5%, hold on to their AH gains logged after the firm reported strong Q3 results. CEO Mark Dunkerley points to Japan as a revenue driver, noting the results are even more impressive given the natural disaster in Japan earlier this year. HA is an outlier among airline stocks with the NYSE Arca Airline Index down 2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • JBHT

    J.B. Hunt (JBHT -2.2%) dips after Suntrust cut the shares to neutral from buy, citing the...

    J.B. Hunt (JBHT -2.2%) dips after Suntrust cut the shares to neutral from buy, citing the company's lack of operating leverage, higher fuel costs and pricing headwinds.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • WERN

    Werner Enterprises (WERN -3.2%) is trading lower, despite its Q3 beating estimates late...

    Werner Enterprises (WERN -3.2%) is trading lower, despite its Q3 beating estimates late yesterday. Profit climbed 22% as the trucker again saw double-digit percentage revenue growth and expanded margins. However, the company reported declining utilization numbers and an increase in deadhead miles for July and August, leading to concerns of a slowdown.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM
  • TXT

    Textron (TXT +2.1%) moves higher after its Q3 swung to a profit on a 13.5% rise in revenue Y/Y...

    Textron (TXT +2.1%) moves higher after its Q3 swung to a profit on a 13.5% rise in revenue Y/Y absent prior-year charges and on strong sales in its Cessna and Bell lines of business. The company also raises guidance for FY11, now expecting an EPS of $1.05 to $1.15 a share, reflecting a recent tender for its outstanding convertible notes.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • INFN

    Infinera (INFN -7.3%), a maker of optical networking gear, gets clocked after reporting Q3...

    Infinera (INFN -7.3%), a maker of optical networking gear, gets clocked after reporting Q3 results. While revenue of $104M (-20% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.09 beat expectations by $4.1M and $0.02, the company's Q4 guidance ranges are largely below Street forecasts. Rival Ciena (CIEN -2.7%) is falling in sympathy. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • STJ

    St. Jude Medical (STJ +7%) ramps higher after its Q3 beats across the board. Profits jumped 8.7%...

    St. Jude Medical (STJ +7%) ramps higher after its Q3 beats across the board. Profits jumped 8.7% Y/Y on better international sales growth and a currency boost, offsetting a soft U.S. market for the company's heart-rhythm devices.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • ZLTQ

    Shares of Zeltiq Aesthetics (ZLTQ +19.2%) are changing hands at $15.50, after completing a $91M...

    Shares of Zeltiq Aesthetics (ZLTQ +19.2%) are changing hands at $15.50, after completing a $91M IPO at $14/share. Zeltiq, a developer of a fat-reduction procedure, reported 1H 2011 revenue of $31.6M (+377% Y/Y), and a net loss of $1.4M. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • SINA

    SINA spikes higher on a video from CCTV in which the state media is commending the Twitter of...

    SINA spikes higher on a video from CCTV in which the state media is commending the Twitter of China, among other things, praising the site's impact on social progress. Shares +5.6%. Translation coming soon!
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • SEIC

    SEI Investments (SEIC -6.2%) trades down after its Q3 results fell short of estimates. Net...

    SEI Investments (SEIC -6.2%) trades down after its Q3 results fell short of estimates. Net revenue was hurt by the volatile capital markets and a decline in assets under management, while margins were hit by the company's heavy investment in infrastructure projects.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • BPOP

    Shares of Popular (BPOP -13%) sink after the Puerto Rican bank's Q3 profit plunges 94% Y/Y and...

    Shares of Popular (BPOP -13%) sink after the Puerto Rican bank's Q3 profit plunges 94% Y/Y and misses the consensus estimate of analysts by $0.03. The year-ago comparable included a $640M gain from the sale of BPOP's interest in Evertec.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM | 1 Comment
  • RIO

    Rio Tinto (RIO -1.9%) is making a C$578M all-cash bid for Canadian uranium miner Hathor...

    Rio Tinto (RIO -1.9%) is making a C$578M all-cash bid for Canadian uranium miner Hathor Exploration (OTC:HTHXF). The offer represents an 11% premium to an August bid from Cameco (CCJ -2.9%). Politicians might object to Rio Tinto's bid out of a wish to see Hathor acquired by a fellow Canadian firm.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 1 Comment

  • Comerica (CMA -2%%) trades lower after its Q3 earnings missed the mark this morning, despite a...

    Comerica (CMA -2%%) trades lower after its Q3 earnings missed the mark this morning, despite a 66% Y/Y jump in profits from its acquisition of Sterling Bancshares. The company reported an EPS of $0.51 per share on revenue of $98M, below analysts' expectations for $0.53 cents a share.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • AMZN

    Whole Foods Market (WFM) jumps 5% higher after catching an upgrade to Buy from Jefferies analyst...

    Whole Foods Market (WFM) jumps 5% higher after catching an upgrade to Buy from Jefferies analyst Scott Mushkin on higher earnings expectations. He also raises his price target on shares to $90 from $68 - repping 24% upside potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • BBY

    Prices of flat-screen TVs are in free-fall and represent a "significant risk" to Q3 gross...

    Prices of flat-screen TVs are in free-fall and represent a "significant risk" to Q3 gross margins at Best Buy (BBY -1.2%), prompting Citigroup analyst Kate McShane to repeat her Sell rating on the shares. "Near-term pressures including a weak product cycle and increasingly price conscious consumers will continue to weigh on the stock in the near term.”

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • CCK

    Crown Holdings (NYSE:CCK) tacks on a 3.3% gain after beating estimates on Q3 EPS by two cents....

    Crown Holdings (NYSE:CCK) tacks on a 3.3% gain after beating estimates on Q3 EPS by two cents. Strong demand for the company's food products in Brazil and Asia helped push the company's percentage of sales outside the U.S. to 73%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • ATMI

    Chip packaging firm ATMI gains 6.7% after reporting Q3 results, even though revenue of $95M...

    Chip packaging firm ATMI gains 6.7% after reporting Q3 results, even though revenue of $95M (flat Y/Y) missed Street expectations by $3M. Investors, who appear to have priced in some bad news, are likely focusing on the fact EPS of $0.25 met expectations in spite of the semiconductor industry's recent downturn (I, II).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • SVU

    Shares of SuperValu (NYSE:SVU) shoot up 3.8% after the firm records an earnings beat and revises...

    Shares of SuperValu (NYSE:SVU) shoot up 3.8% after the firm records an earnings beat and revises its guidance slightly lower. The company sees same-store sales growth in a range of -2% to -2.5%, and plans on capital expenditures of $700M-$725M to be used in part on store remodels.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • RRC

    Range Resources (RRC -2.6%) sells off after Canaccord downgrades the oil and gas producer to...

    Range Resources (RRC -2.6%) sells off after Canaccord downgrades the oil and gas producer to Sell, with a $60 PT. The firm thinks a buyout is "increasingly unlikely," in spite of investor hopes, and is worried about infrastructure constraints and "regional price degradation" related to its Marcellus shale gas field.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • APOL

    Apollo Group's (APOL +9%) strong FQ4 report and FY12 guidance helps lift shares of other names...

    Apollo Group's (APOL +9%) strong FQ4 report and FY12 guidance helps lift shares of other names in the education services sector. Gainers: CECO +4.1%, DV +5.1%, ESI-OLD +3.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • INTC

    Intel (INTC +4.4%) remains higher after beating Q3 forecasts, providing decent Q4 guidance, and...

    Intel (INTC +4.4%) remains higher after beating Q3 forecasts, providing decent Q4 guidance, and reiterating its claim that emerging markets and enterprise PC demand is offsetting consumer weakness in the West. However, FBR and Susquehanna remain skeptics, asking why other PC industry players aren't showing strength. AMD is down slightly today. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • ROC

    Shares of Rockwood (NYSE:ROC) move down 8.4% on heavy volume after the company misses Q3...

    Shares of Rockwood (NYSE:ROC) move down 8.4% on heavy volume after the company misses Q3 consensus estimates on revenue, reporting $940.9M vs. $968.9M.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • AAL

    Shares of American Airlines (NASDAQ:AMR) trade 7.8% lower after the firm's Q3 report shows a...

    Shares of American Airlines (NASDAQ:AMR) trade 7.8% lower after the firm's Q3 report shows a $0.33/share loss after adjusting for certain charges - missing the consensus estimate of analysts. The company says higher fuel prices (+41% Y/Y) negatively impacted performance, only partially offset by hedging. For Q4, the carrier plans for an average system fuel price of $3.02/gallon on consolidated consumption of 667M gallons of jet fuel.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • TKLC

    Tekelec (NASDAQ:TKLC), a provider of communications infrastructure software, gains 13.7% after...

    Tekelec (NASDAQ:TKLC), a provider of communications infrastructure software, gains 13.7% after preannouncing Q3 revenue of $103M-$106M and EPS of $0.16-$0.20, above a consensus of $92.6M and $0.06. In addition, the company reports receiving a $20M order for its Diameter IP signaling software, which was launched last October.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM

  • European shares and the euro give up some more gains as Reuters reports French President...

    European shares and the euro give up some more gains as Reuters reports French President Sarkozy, on the way to Berlin for more bazooka talks, has told lawmakers in his party that negotiations are stuck over relations between the EFSF and the ECB. The only thing sillier than selling on this chatter was buying on the chatter that proceeded it.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • AEM

    Agnico-Eagle Mines (NYSE:AEM) drops 14.9% premarket after the company announces it's suspending...

    Agnico-Eagle Mines (NYSE:AEM) drops 14.9% premarket after the company announces it's suspending operations at a Quebec gold mine, following the collapse of a "weak volcanic rock unit." Agnico-Eagle expects to write off its investment in the mine for a post-tax loss of $170M, or $1/share.
